admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund: TF020350-DANISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF025201-PHRD-FEED INDUSTRY DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Agricultural Support
            Services Project is rated as satisfactory, sustainability as
            highly likely, institutional development impact as
            substantial, Bank performance as satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance as satisfactory. The project has successfully
            achieved its objectives. Agricultural development and
            project implementation suffered from the severe floods in
            both 1994 and 1998. Some lessons drawn from this project
            include: 1) Strong, stable and consistent management both
            for the Borrower and the Bank is essential for the
            successful implementation of institutional development
            projects. 2) In multi-province projects, special
            arrangements and greater autonomy in project procurement
            needs to be given to the individual provinces in the
            interests of appropriate equipment procurement and good
            accountability. 3) Project staff should receive more
            substantial training in contract management, International
            Competitive Bidding and World Bank procurement procedures at
            or before project commencement. 4) The project Special
            Account is intended to provide some accelerated
            reimbursement of expenditures made from local counterpart
            funds and can only operate effectively if it is managed by
            the agency responsible. 5) Adequate funding and priority has
            to be given to monitoring and evaluation if project
            management is to have up to date and good information for
            project operation.
